intro: Hieracium acrozum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium acrozum is often found in high-altitude ecosystems and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
